data.feedback: The planning agent has created a comprehensive, well-structured plan that covers ALL 9 user-requested epics for the Flutter frontend. The epics correctly align with the existing backend API routes, models, and WebSocket events. The architecture follows Flutter best practices with feature-based clean architecture (data/domain/presentation layers). File paths for modifications are accurate - I verified pubspec.yaml, main.dart, analysis_options.yaml, AndroidManifest.xml, build.gradle, and Info.plist all exist.

issues.description: ios/Podfile listed in filesToModify but doesn't exist yet - will be auto-generated by Flutter/CocoaPods on first iOS build
Duplicate entries in dependencies arrays (e.g., epic-ui-foundation has 'epic-flutter-foundation' twice)
executionOrder values inconsistent - multiple epics share the same order value (e.g., several have executionOrder: 2)

suggestions: Clean up duplicate dependency entries in epic dependency arrays
Assign unique, sequential executionOrder values for clearer ordering
Consider adding ios/Podfile to filesToCreate instead of filesToModify, or add note that it will be auto-generated
